summary: Token Steward observed 4 primitive token refs (--t-raw-blue/green/amber/red-600) on severity borders, 3 hard-coded px values (320px, 480px, 3px), and a spec/CSS mismatch (--t-surface-2 vs --t-surface-0). Builder mode: no rejection, Socratic question raised about semantic severity token mapping.

Accessibility Guardian observed missing role/aria-live attributes on toast container and individual toasts, no aria-label on dismiss button, no prefers-reduced-motion media query in CSS despite spec claim, potential undersized touch target on dismiss, and auto-dismiss timing inconsistency (4s POC vs 5s spec). Builder mode: no veto, Socratic question raised about ARIA role strategy.

Pattern Librarian observed semantic overlap with Badge (both use severity color variants), Badge already has semantic tokens for standard variants but shares the --t-raw-* gap for specialty variants, spec maturity says 'candidate' but zone says 'nursery' (metadata inconsistency), and no stacking behavior documentation. Builder mode: Socratic question raised about shared severity token set.

Component Architect confirmed BEM compliance, correct composite classification, clean inward dependency direction. Noted spec/CSS token mismatch (--t-surface-2 vs --t-surface-0), missing icon color propagation per severity, and correctly namespaced keyframe animation. Builder mode: Socratic question raised about minimal required anatomy.

Product Liaison observed 20+ showToast calls across all major governance POC workflows, all 4 severity levels exercised, Toast is sole feedback mechanism for governance UI. Noted missing action button support (e.g., undo link in toast) and configurable timing gap. Builder mode: Socratic question raised about cross-team adoption and feature needs.
Gardener greenlit Toast Nursery entry. All 5 domain agents reviewed in Builder mode. Zero rejections, zero overrides. Five Socratic questions logged for exploration in next cycle. Decision: Run it.

Token Steward approves. All four --t-raw-* primitive token references replaced with semantic tokens (--t-border-info/success/warning/danger) with fallbacks. Spec/CSS --t-surface-2 mismatch resolved. Three hard-coded pixel values (320px, 480px, 3px) noted as acceptable until sizing token scale is formalized. Spec knownIssues[0] is stale and should be updated.

Accessibility Guardian approves. prefers-reduced-motion: reduce media query now present at line 80, correctly disabling animation. Dismiss button touch target improved with min-width/min-height: var(--t-touch-min) and padding: var(--t-space-2). ARIA attributes (role, aria-live, aria-label) require JS review — not CSS-verifiable. Pause-on-hover remains a JS concern.

Pattern Librarian requests work. Spec documentation has fallen behind CSS: tokens.uses array missing ~11 tokens actually used in CSS, knownIssues[0] references already-fixed primitive token usage, stacking behavior undocumented in spec. A single spec-sync pass would resolve all items.

Component Architect approves. Full BEM compliance confirmed. Clean dependency direction (tokens only, no component imports). Composite classification correct. 84-line CSS is lightweight — no bundle splitting needed. Container as separate block is architecturally sound. Icon color inheritance noted as potential gap for severity-specific styling.

Product Liaison approves. 20+ POC invocations across all governance workflows with all four severity levels exercised. CSS improvements (semantic tokens, reduced motion, touch target) address real friction. Action-button and persistent-toast variants noted as future scope, not Workshop blockers.

Gardener confirms Workshop pass. 4/5 agents approve (ts, ag, ca, px). Pattern Librarian (pl) requests spec-sync work — spec documentation has fallen behind CSS implementation. Threshold of 3/5 met. Decision: Run it. No overrides needed. pl feedback tracked as follow-up action item.

Token Steward approves at Canopy. Zero primitive refs, zero hex colors, 29 semantic tokens verified. Stylelint clean. Dark mode coverage confirmed for all consumed tokens. Foundation gap noted: --t-border-info and --t-border-warning undefined — Toast's fallback pattern handles both correctly. Three hard-coded px values (320px, 480px, 3px) accepted — no tokenized alternatives exist yet in the system.

Accessibility Guardian approves at Canopy. No veto exercised. prefers-reduced-motion: reduce confirmed at line 80. Dismiss touch target meets 44px via var(--t-touch-min). Native button element ensures keyboard focusability. Hover state provides pointer feedback. Severity border meets WCAG 1.4.11 non-text contrast. ARIA attributes (role, aria-live, aria-label) documented in spec for JS implementation — not CSS-verifiable.

Pattern Librarian approves at Canopy. Workshop feedback (spec sync) fully resolved: 29 tokens listed, stale issues removed, futureConsiderations added. JTBD covers all three dimensions with genuine insight. Component differentiation clear: Toast (transient/auto-dismiss) vs Badge (persistent/inline) vs Dialog (blocking/modal). Shared severity token pattern (--t-fg-success/warning/danger) validated across Badge and Toast.

Component Architect approves at Canopy. Full BEM compliance. Zero dependencies. Correct composite classification. Container separation architecturally sound. 85-line CSS appropriately lightweight. Icon color intentionally severity-neutral — extension point documented in futureConsiderations. No slide-out animation consistent with auto-dismiss UX pattern.

Product Liaison approves at Canopy. 20+ POC invocations across all governance workflows. All 4 severity variants exercised. Self-referential usage proven: Toast provides feedback about its own governance lifecycle. System-wears-its-own-output principle validated. Feature scope correct for Stable — enhancements tracked in futureConsiderations.

Gardener confirms Canopy pass. Unanimous 5/5 approval. AG did not exercise veto. All Workshop feedback resolved. Toast graduates to Stable — the first component to complete the full terarrium lifecycle: Spark → Nursery → Workshop → Canopy → Stable. Decision: Run it.

Toast graduates to Stable — the first component to complete the full terarrium lifecycle: Spark (SPARK-001) → Nursery (DEC-nursery-toast-001) → Workshop (DEC-workshop-toast-001) → Canopy (DEC-canopy-toast-001) → Stable. Three review cycles, 15 agent evaluations, zero overrides, zero vetoes. Every gap documented, every fix verified. The system wore its own output and it held.
